column2: INDIANA DMV TEST
column4: Indiana

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have overslept.
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column10: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.

column2: 2. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: stop much more quickly
column8: stop much more slowly

column2: 3. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column4: larger and deeper
column8: less dangerous

column2: 4. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column8: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

column2: 5. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column4: Edge line
column8: Diamond

column2: 6. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column8: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column10: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.

column2: 7. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column6: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
column8: the first rain after a dry spell.

column2: 8. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: wait for the next green light.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 9. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column4: Both.
column8: You.

column2: 10. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: The other answers are both correct.
column6: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column8: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.

column2: 11. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column6: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column10: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.

column2: 12. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 13. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain near the left edge of the road.
column6: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column8: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.
column10: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.

column2: 14. If driving in foggy weather, drivers should turn on their high-beams to increase the field of vision.
column4: False

column2: 15. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.
column8: they cannot go straight ahead.

column2: 16. The yield sign means:
column4: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column6: You must come to a complete stop.
column8: The traffic light will soon be red.
column10: Drive with caution in wet weather.

column2: 17. These are:
column4: miles-left signs.
column8: route signs.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: Roundabout ahead. Slow down.
column10: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 19. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column8: Shift to a lower gear.

column2: 20. Headlights must be turned on from sunset to sunrise.
column4: True

column2: 21. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 22. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: to signal all lane changes.
column6: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 23. A parent or legal guardian may request that the driver’s license of a minor be cancelled at any time prior to age 18.
column4: False

column2: 24. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column6: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column8: avoid drinking coffee.
column10: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 25. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: change lanes.
column6: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.
column10: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Do not block intersection
column8: Lane shifting

column2: 27. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they cannot go straight ahead.
column6: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 28. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.
column6: use only one hand on the wheel.
column8: not check behind you through your mirrors.

column2: 29. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: signal other vehicles to stop.
column6: slow down and enter the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 30. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column10: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 31. You may turn left through an intersection with a red light or arrow if you are turning from a one-way street onto a one-way street.
column4: False

column2: 32. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 33. Drivers must slow down for a school zone:
column4: only when directed to do so by a school flagger.
column6: On school days between 7 a.m. and 4 p.m. when children are present and signs are posted.
column8: On weekends.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column4: You must turn right at the intersection
column8: Yield sign ahead

column2: 35. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: All of the above.
column6: quick lane changes without a signal.
column8: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 36. It is illegal to drive around a crossing gate that is down.
column4: False

column2: 37. Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians in an unmarked crosswalk.
column4: False

column2: 38. BAC is:
column4: the amount of alcohol in your body.
column6: the number of ounces of alcohol in your blood.
column8: the percentage of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 39. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column10: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 40. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column8: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column10: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.

column2: 41. You should normally activate your directional ____ feet ahead of your intended turn.
42. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column6: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column8: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 43. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: turn left into the one-way road.
column6: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column10: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.

column2: 44. This sign warns that:
column4: traffic must merge left.
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 45. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: Never use
column8: Always rely on
column10: It is not recommended to check

column2: 46. This road sign means:
column4: You must turn right
column8: Steep downgrade

column2: 47. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: watch for this species crossing the road.
column6: be ready to hit a reindeer.
column8: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 48. This is:
column4: a right curve sign.
column8: a merging traffic sign.

column2: 49. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column6: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column8: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.
column10: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.

column2: 50. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column8: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
